page.title: 14The Irvine Carters Society
page.content: Once{Irvine}was the busiest seaport on the west coast of Scotland and goods were carried from the ships by pack horses. The men who owned the pack horses were called{Cadgers.}Later they began to use carts and changed their name to{Carters.}They were very important men and travelled as far as Glasgow with their goods.On at least one occasion they carried goods to Aberdeen.{King Robert the Bruce}asked for their help and men from Irvine Carters Society helped Bruce defeat the English at the{Battle of {Bannockburn.}Because of this, Bruce decreed that Irvine should become a{ {Royal Burgh.}The Royal Charter was presented in 1372 by Bruce's grandson,{King Robert II,}the first Stuart monarch.The Carters also fought for{Mary Queen of Scots}at the Battle of Langside.
